document_data.name: Xiousing
document_data.mainbody: '''Xiousing''' ({{Pronounce|yow|SING}}) was a small, cramped district in northern [[Marsember]] in [[Cormyr]] inhabited primarily by [[Shou]].{{Cite dungeon/195/Backdrop: Xiousing}}
document_data.Organizations:
* [[Cult of the Dragon]] – A venerable cult dedicated to bringing about the rule of [[dracolich|dracoliches]].
* [[Nine Golden Swords]] – An infamous Shou gang.
* [[Purple Dragon Knights]] – Cormyrean knights who maintained a barracks just outside of Xiousing.  A few of the knights were Shou.
* [[The Chuen]] – A traditionalist Shou organization hostile to non-Shou.
document_data.Inhabitants:
* [[Burgher Xarod]] – Original boss of the Xiousing district.
* [[Duc-Sum Li]] – Founder and Regent of Xiousing.
* [[Shiau Chen]] – Owner of the Lily Pad inn.
* [[Yi Woo]] - Healer	
* [[Jang]] - Former Local who joined the [[Marsember Watch]].
document_data.Locations:
* [[Chiang Laundry]]
* [[Double Dragon Gambling Hall]] – A secret gambling establishment.
* [[Lightning Dragon Dojo]] – Martial arts school run by Duc-Sum.	
* [[Lily Pad Inn]] – A three-story inn run by a Shou and his Cormyrean wife.
* [[Shen's Herb Garden]] - 
* Shrine of [[Tymora]]
* The Zhao – A pond that provided drinking water.
* [[Yi Wu's Clinic]] – A healing center.
* [[Zhang's Teahouse]] – An establishment that served Shou tea.
document_data.History:
Xiousing was built on land exposed after the level of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] dropped in the years following the [[Spellplague]]. The original Shou squatters on the new land were ruled by Burgher Xarod.

In the {{YearlinkName|1419}}, a Shou noble named Duc-Sum Li and his son were traveling through Cormyr. Crown Prince [[Foril I]] was very ill and no Cormyrean healers could heal him. King [[Azoun V|Azoun Obarskyr V]] summoned Duc-Sum to court and the Shou was able to heal the prince. In gratitude, King Azoun knighted Duc-Sum and granted him control over a small parcel of land in Marsember inhabited by Shou squatters.

As of the {{YearlinkName|1479}}, Xiousing was a bustling community inhabited mostly by Shou.
